description:
This is a protocol to generate axenic fly cultures by sterilizing embryos. It is part of the manuscript: Gonçalves et al. Commensal bacteria and essential amino acids control food choice behavior and reproduction. Plos Biology. 2017 Apr 18.

 

The protocol was adapted from:

 

Wayland MT, Defaye A, Rocha J, Jayaram SA, Royet J, Miguel-Aliaga I, et al. Spotting the differences: Probing host/microbiota interactions with a dedicated software tool for the analysis of faecal outputs in Drosophila. J Insect Physiol. 2014;69: 126–135. doi:10.1016/j.jinsphys.2014.05.023

 

with the help of the Leulier laboratory.

keywords: Drosophila, holidic medium, axenic, gnotobiotic, feeding behavior, feeding decisions, microbiota, diet, nutrients

guidelines:
Prepare high yeast-based medium (HYBM) as follows:

  • add 8 g agar, 80 g barley malt syrup, 22 g sugar beet syrup, 80 g corn flour, 10 g soya flour, 41.67 g instant yeast, 8 ml propionic acid, 12 ml nipagin (15% in 96% ethanol), 416.7 µg/ml tetracycline (high dose), 41.67 µg/ml chloramphenicol, 41.67 µg/ml ampicillin, and 8.333 µg/ml erythromycin and make up to 1000 ml of milliQ filtered water
  • autoclave before pouring into polypropylene fly culture vials (VWR, #734-2261)
  • DO NOT supplement the food with instant yeast granules on the surface

 

The high yeast concentration is to compensate for the developmental delay observed in axenic larvae (Storelli G, Defaye A, Erkosar B, Hols P, Royet J, Leulier F. Lactobacillus plantarum Promotes Drosophila Systemic Growth by Modulating Hormonal Signals through TOR-Dependent Nutrient Sensing. Cell Metab. 2011;14: 403–414. doi:10.1016/j.cmet.2011.07.012).

 

 

Perform all fly rearing, maintenance, and behavioral testing at 25°C in climate-controlled chambers at 70% relative humidity in a 12-hr-light-dark cycle (Aralab, FitoClima 60000EH).

components.data: Put females and males to lay eggs in cages containing apple juice plates with yeast paste for 3 to 5 h at 25ºC. Avoid longer time periods to prevent the presence of larvae in the protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put females and males to lay eggs in cages containing apple juice plates with yeast paste for 3 to 5 h at 25ºC. Avoid longer time periods to prevent the presence of larvae in the protocol.

components.data: Collect eggs by rinsing the apple juice plates with deonized water and transfering the liquid with eggs to nitex baskets. Ensure that no larvae contaminate the egg collection!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect eggs by rinsing the apple juice plates with deonized water and transfering the liquid with eggs to nitex baskets. Ensure that no larvae contaminate the egg collection!

components.data: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the embryos into a petri dish containing 2.5% active chlorine (50% bleach) for 2 min until the chorion is removed. Confirm that the eggs are dechorionated using a stereo microscope.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the embryos into a petri dish containing 2.5% active chlorine (50% bleach) for 2 min until the chorion is removed. Confirm that the eggs are dechorionated using a stereo microscope.

components.data: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the dechorionated eggs into a petri dish containing autoclaved distilled water for 2 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the dechorionated eggs into a petri dish containing autoclaved distilled water for 2 min.

components.data: Transfer the embryos using a sterilized brush from the basket into sterile HYBM (autoclaved before pouring it into sterile culture vials) containing antibiotics.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the embryos using a sterilized brush from the basket into sterile HYBM (autoclaved before pouring it into sterile culture vials) containing antibiotics.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Generating and Rearing Axenic Drosophila
source_data.annotation:
The high yeast concentration is to compensate for the developmental delay observed in axenic larvae.

(see: Storelli G, Defaye A, Erkosar B, Hols P, Royet J, Leulier F. Lactobacillus plantarum Promotes Drosophila Systemic Growth by Modulating Hormonal Signals through TOR-Dependent Nutrient Sensing. Cell Metab. 2011;14: 403–414. doi:10.1016/j.cmet.2011.07.012).

(see: Storelli G, Defaye A, Erkosar B, Hols P, Royet J, Leulier F. Lactobacillus plantarum Promotes Drosophila Systemic Growth by Modulating Hormonal Signals through TOR-Dependent Nutrient Sensing. Cell Metab. 2011;14: 403–414. doi:10.1016/j.cmet.2011.07.012).

The high yeast concentration is to compensate for the developmental delay observed in axenic larvae.

(see: Storelli G, Defaye A, Erkosar B, Hols P, Royet J, Leulier F. Lactobacillus plantarum Promotes Drosophila Systemic Growth by Modulating Hormonal Signals through TOR-Dependent Nutrient Sensing. Cell Metab. 2011;14: 403–414. doi:10.1016/j.cmet.2011.07.012).

components.data: Transfer axenic flies regularly into vials containing freshly prepared antibiotic-supplemented sterile HYBM.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer axenic flies regularly into vials containing freshly prepared antibiotic-supplemented sterile HYBM.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Generating and Rearing Axenic Drosophila
source_data.annotation: If axenic flies are kept at room temperature flip to new food every 25 days.
source_data.thread_text: If axenic flies are kept at room temperature flip to new food every 25 days.
source_data.body: If axenic flies are kept at room temperature flip to new food every 25 days.

components.data: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the dechorionated eggs into a petri dish containing 70% ethanol for 2 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the nitex baskets containing the dechorionated eggs into a petri dish containing 70% ethanol for 2 min.

components.data:
Move to the laminar flow hood maintaining the dechorionated eggs in the ethanol solution.

 

To avoid contaminations, the next steps of this protocol are performed in a laminar flow hood.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Move to the laminar flow hood maintaining the dechorionated eggs in the ethanol solution.

 

To avoid contaminations, the next steps of this protocol are performed in a laminar flow hood.

components.data: Assess the absence of bacteria according to the protocol to calculate the internal bacterial load of the flies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Assess the absence of bacteria according to the protocol to calculate the internal bacterial load of the flies.

components.data: Prepare high yeast-based medium (HYBM) according to Guidelines.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare high yeast-based medium (HYBM) according to Guidelines.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Generating and Rearing Axenic Drosophila
source_data.annotation: HYBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.
source_data.thread_text: HYBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.
source_data.body: HYBM can be stored at 18ºC up to 3 days before use.
